subject: Business
title: Open Innovation: Ideas from Outside
description: A fast breakdown of Open Innovation: Ideas from Outside for builders.

hook.text: Procter & Gamble's CEO admitted: 'Most innovation doesn't come from our own labs anymore.'

buildup.text: Open innovation means using external ideas, partnerships, and technologies alongside internal R&D.

discovery.text: P&G's Connect + Develop program sources half its innovations externally. It cut R&D costs significantly.

twist.text: The challenge: internal teams resist external ideas. 'Not invented here' syndrome kills promising imports.

climax.text: Linux, Wikipedia, and Android all prove that open collaboration can outperform closed R&D.

punchline.text: The smartest people don't all work for you. Invite them in.

quiz.question: What is the 'not invented here' syndrome?
options: Internal resistance to ideas that come from outside the organization
A legal issue with importing foreign products
A problem with patent filing across countries
